To setup your Outreach app in Cobalt for OAuth, you will need the following credentials from your Outreach Developer account : Client ID Client Secret Scopes ​ Pre-requisites Outreach Developer account. ​ Required Settings Mandatory Scopes users.read If you haven’t already created an app in Outreach, you’d need to create one. ​ Creating an app in Outreach To create a Outreach app and aquire the above mentioned credentials, please follow the steps mentioned below: Log in to your Outreach Developer account . Click on the Create App button in the right. Enter the App Name and App identifier > Agree to the terms and click Create . Go to Feature Selection in the side menu, select Outreach API (OAuth) under Data connectors and click Add feature . Go to your Apps catalog in Cobalt > Search for Outreach > Settings > Use your credentials > Callback Url > Copy it. Under Callback URL , click on + Add new URL and paste it. Select the mandatory scopes in the API Scopes section, as provided in your Cobalt Outreach settings page and click on the Save button. Scroll to the top in API Access(OAuth) section and copy the OAuth Application ID and Application Secret from either Development or Production depending on requirements. ​ Configuring credentials in Cobalt App settings page lets you configure the authentication settings for an OAuth 2.0 based application. For your customers to provide you authorization to access their data, they would first need to install your application. This page lets you set up your application credentials. Cobalt lets you use pre-configured applications to play around. You can do so by selecting Use our credentials . However, if you wish to use your own application, select Use your own credentials . Provide the aquired Client Id and Client secret and save it. ​ Configuring Scopes Cobalt lets you configure what permissions to ask from your users while they install your application. The scopes can be added or removed from the App settings page, under Permissions & Scopes section. For some applications Cobalt sets mandatory scopes which cannot be removed. Additional scopes can be selected from the drop down. Cobalt also has the provision to add any custom scopes supported by the respective platform. Once the scopes has been added to the application in Cobalt, go to your Outreach Developer account and update the scopes as added on Cobalt. Select the OAuth App created for Cobalt > Click on API Access(OAuth) under App features > Add the scopes under API Scopes as added in Cobalt > Click on Save . If you are facing scopes missing or invalid scope error. Make sure you are not passing any custom scope not supported by the platform. And, the scopes selected here are identical to the ones selected in the platform. ​ Getting Production Credentials of App For each Outreach app, the development and production credentials are generated separately. Production credentials are provisioned after the app goes through the publishing process of Outreach and eventually a review. To more about the Outreach App Publishing process, refer here . ​ Actions and triggers Once the above setup is completed, you can create orchestrations of your use-cases using Outreach actions and triggers. Following are the set of Outreach actions and triggers supported by Cobalt. Actions Triggers Accounts Create Account - Create a new account in Outreach. List Accounts - Get a list of accounts in Outreach. Opportunity Create Opportunity - Create a new opportunity in Outreach. List Opportunities - Get a list of opportunities in Outreach. Delete Opportunity - Delete an opportunity in Outreach. Prospects Create Prospect - Create a new prospect in Outreach. Get Prospect By Id - Get a prospect by ID in Outreach. Update Prospect - Update a prospect in Outreach. Stages List Stages - Get a list of stages in Outreach. Users List Users - Get a list of users in Outreach. Create User - Create a new user in Outreach. Others HTTP Request - Make HTTP API calls to any Outreach documented REST APIs.
